Row.Text: A lumbering Renaissance Era melee unit, excels at hit and run tactics.

The Camel War Party is a motley collection of partisans, renegades, and criminals. It is a melee unit that can move after combat. It also receives +33% attack bonus when attacking from Desert tiles, doubles its movement in Desert tiles, and can pillage at no movement cost.

The Camel War Party is an inexpensive Renaissance Era melee unit that specializes in hit-and-run tactics, available at the discovery of Gunpowder. It becomes obsolete at the discovery of Combustion, and may upgrade to the Great War Infantry unit upon the discovery of Replaceable Parts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]These units specialize in seizing and destroying military objectives, usually in enemy territory. These raids area military tactic or operational warfare mission which has a specific purpose and is not normally intended to capture and hold terrain, but instead finish with the raiding force quickly retreating to a previous defended position prior to enemy forces being able to respond in a coordinated manner or formulate a counter-attack. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]These War Party units differ from Raiding Parties in that their primary aim is to damage the enemy's ability to conduct military operations. Like Raiding Parties, these units also consist of combatants specially trained in raiding tactics, such as commandos, or as a special mission assigned to any general troops. Raids are often a standard tactic in irregular warfare, employed by warriors, guerrilla fighters, or other irregular military forces.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The purposes of a raid may include: to demoralize, confuse, or exhaust the enemy; to ransack, pillage, or plunder; to destroy specific goods or installations of military or economic value; to free Prisoners Of War; to capture enemy soldiers for interrogation; to kill or capture specific key persons; and to gather intelligence.
